title: Part A: Thesis
stimulusHtml:
A thesis is an arguable statement about a subject.

In this task, students are asked to practice drafting a thesis statement for an Argument Free-Response Question. While this task is shortened to provide students with practice, the focus of the skills remains the same.

By the end of Unit 2, students should have enough experience with developing and conveying claims to compose a coherent thesis statement for this free-response question.
descriptions: The response demonstrates at least one of the following:
Responds to the prompt with a thesis that presents a defensible position.

title: Part B: Evidence and Commentary
stimulusHtml:
A piece of information becomes evidence when a writer establishes a logical relationship between the information and a thesis.

Commentary connects the evidence and reasoning to the thesis.

In Unit 2, students continue to develop the skills involved in making and supporting defensible claims. At this point in this course, students are just beginning to develop the skills involved in explaining the relationship between evidence and claims; thus, students are only identifying and explaining two pieces of evidence in this formative free-response question. Students will be able to earn up to 4 points in this row when they write full essays in later units and on the summative AP Exam.
